ModMetaData.name: Alpha Genes
ModMetaData.author: Allie, Erin, Sarg
ModMetaData.description:
Adds new genes and xenotypes to Rimworld.
<size=24>Features</size>
- More than 250 new genes. Some are very low impact, while some are truly game changing. - 14 new xenotypes with wild mechanics. - A new "Custom random" xenotype that allows you to make new player created xenotypes, and have them loaded into two new custom factions. - Abandoned Biotech labs quests, similar to the ones in VE Genetics, that give access to all the new genes during play. - Genetic tools that allow you to tweak your colonists' genes. Obtainable through lab quests or normal quest rewards.
<size=24>Issues</size>
No issues known at the moment
<size=24>Plans for the future</size>
Oh you can bet I will add new things!
<size=24>Changelog</size>
v2.0: 9 new assorted genes (19/12/23) v1.9: Added new xenotypes, the Mycomorph (require Vanilla Races Expanded - Fungoid), as well as 8 new genes (30/09/23) v1.8: Added two new xenotypes, the Rox-touched (require medieval Overhaul) and the Drakonori, as well as around 30 new genes (25/09/23) v1.7: Mechanitor and Android genes (24/05/23) v1.6: Added a new xenotype, the Malachai, when Vanilla Races Expanded - Sanguophages is installed too (17/04/23) v1.5: Added a new xenotype, the Ocularkin, when Vanilla Races Expanded - Phytokin is installed too (03/02/23) v1.4: Added a new xenotype, Efreet, as well as a lot of new genes (02/01/23) v1.3: Added two new xenotypes, Mind devourers and Hivelings, as well as a lot of new genes (19/12/22) v1.2: Added new xenotype: the Taukai (07/12/22) v1.0: Release (22/11/22) v0.1: Beta (14/11/22) Full changelog on GitHub
